section.title: Configuring the default content sources
section.para: If the Media Explorer user has the standard GNOME home directory layout (i.e. $HOME/Downloads, $HOME/Videos, $HOME/Pictures), Media Explorer should automatically "see" any content added to those directories and present it to the user.

However, when using a non-standard directory layout, or if you want to access files outside the default directories, the user needs to configure Tracker (which provides the content indexing service) from the command line with:
Under the Locations tab, add the appropriate directories to the Recursively Indexed directory list.
Now Tracker should find and index content in those directories, making them accessible via Media Explorer.
To find out more, see this section about how Media Explorer discovers content.

section.title: Configuring extra content sources
section.para: Media Explorer allows you to search through metadata about media from a variety of sources. By default, it has access to media on your local filesystem and on UPnP devices on your network.

However, Media Explorer can search beyond these if you provide it with access to more sources, such as Flickr and YouTube. Typically, this is done by supplying an API key (or keys) in a Grilo configuration file. Media Explorer uses Grilo to authenticate against content sources and to search/browse their media and metadata.

warning.para: If you are using a version of Media Explorer supplied with a MeeGo distribution, it may not be possible to add extra content sources beyond the defaults.

If your version of Media Explorer is supplied by a 3rd party (outside the official MeeGo distribution) or if you have built Media Explorer yourself, extra content sources may be available and this section may be applicable.
If you want to work out which Grilo plugins are available in your version of Media Explorer, see this section for instructions.

section.para: To configure content sources, use the Grilo configuration file, typically located in $HOME/.config/mex/grilo-system.conf.
